intro: Swertia tetrapetala f. impunctata, commonly known as the white-flowered gentian, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its showy, often blue or violet flowers. The plant features lanceolate leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, and its flowers are tubular with five lobes, often with a white or pale coloration. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
